text: Cześć wszystkim! Dziękuję, że dołączyłeś do mnie i mojego psa Teda w tej przygodzie! Dziś mamy taką zdrową, nastrojową pogodę. Dużo deszczu i mgły. Uwielbiam patrzeć na mgłę poruszającą się tak szybko po górach! Próbuję dziś nowej plandeki, jest wykonana z płótna. Wypuszczając Teda, zobaczmy, czy chce zostać na zewnątrz, czy poczekać w samochodzie, aż schronisko będzie gotowe. Ok, Ted ma dość zwiedzania, chce poczekać w samochodzie. Ten film jest sponsorowany przez NATUREHIKE Jakie to fajne, otwiera się na dwa palniki. Jestem pod wrażeniem. Jakość tego pieca jest świetna i wygląda świetnie. Podoba mi się połączenie kolorów, jest idealne na kemping. Jestem bardzo podekscytowany możliwością przetestowania mojego nowego sprzętu do gotowania. To naprawdę miłe! Zapalniki wydają się być bardzo niezawodne. Ani razu nie zawiodły przez cały mój dzień na kempingu. Dzisiaj ugotuję makaron carbonara. Przydadzą się więc dwa palniki! Mam jeszcze kilka nowych elementów, dzięki którym będzie miło i uporządkowanie! Uwielbiam to! Robi się chłodno, dobrze, że zabrałam ze sobą ciepłe ubrania. Nie spodziewałem się tego latem w Australii. Wydaje mi się, że w górach zawsze jest chłodniej. Oczywiście Ted nie uczestniczy w części dotyczącej gotowania. Mam trochę smażonych warzyw z kurczaka dla Teda. On to uwielbia. Czas ugotować makaron! Mniam! Ted pełni służbę wartowniczą i pilnuje, aby żadna krowa nie podeszła zbyt blisko! Obserwuje nas jedna ciekawa krowa. „Co gotujesz?!” Takie niesamowite widoki stąd! Co ja robię, nie potrzebuję noża, żeby zjeść makaron xD Mój makaron jest gotowy! Czas coś zjeść i nacieszyć się widokami! Ach, cieszę się teraz w pełni swoją chwilą. Ok, oboje jesteśmy najedzeni, teraz przygotujmy schronienie, w którym będziemy mogli spać dziś wieczorem! Mam dziś ze sobą ciekawy namiot od Naturehike. To rodzaj modułowości! Ma to sens, gdy podczas pieszych wędrówek chcesz czasami rozłożyć ciężar między siebie i swojego partnera. Całkiem sprytny. Kołki są wysokiej jakości. Niezwykle lekki i mały namiot, odpowiedni do pieszych wędrówek. Jest też dość przestronny, zmieści się w nim mój pełnowymiarowy podwójny materac. Cała konstrukcja słupa jest już ze sobą połączona, więc jej ustawienie jest dość łatwe. Wszystko w tym namiocie sprawia wrażenie lekkiego, ale trwałego. Spójrz na Teda, nie może się doczekać, aby wejść i przetestować nowy namiot! OK, ten namiot zyskał aprobatę Teda! Sukces! Zróbmy sobie teraz krótką przerwę i odpocznijmy trochę. Co za magiczna noc. Obóz świeci, czas rozpalić przytulne ognisko i trochę się rozgrzać. Być może szybka kolacja przy ognisku. Kelly przygotowała dla mnie i Teda odpowiedni zestaw posiłków na kolację. Miło z jej strony! Dziękuję! To jest dla Teda! Tak szybkie i łatwe w przygotowaniu. I bardzo pyszne! JMT! Ted uwielbiał swój posiłek, nic nie zostało! Mam zamiar zjeść, odpocząć i obejrzeć kilka filmów przed pójściem spać! Dobranoc wszystkim! Ted już wyszedł i czeka na mnie. To był bardzo dobry, komfortowy sen. Nie przejmuj się, że rano wyglądam jak Chewbacca. Potrzebuję kawy, natychmiast! Nadal pada deszcz. Cieszę się, że namiot jest odpowiednio wodoszczelny. Zmielmy świeżą kawę! Tam na dole znajdują się majestatyczne lasy deszczowe. Biwakowałem tam już wcześniej, muszę wkrótce wrócić! Takie miłe miejsce! Czas się spakować i ruszyć w kolejny cel! Dziękujemy, że do nas dołączyłeś! Pakowanie jest łatwe i przyjemne, gdy wszystko ma swoje miejsce! Pakowanie namiotu było tak proste, jak jego rozstawienie. Ładny! Mam nadzieję, że podobał Ci się ten odcinek! Do zobaczenia w kolejnym miejscu docelowym! Sprawdź więcej filmów na naszym kanale YouTube „Go4x4”.

hey everyone Anthony here from the global gaming and welcome back to our Minecraft Guide Series today we're diving into how to whip up a potion of healing also known as instant Health right in your own Minecraft world whether you're battling mobs or just after some quick Health boosts this potion is a must-have in your inventory let's start with the basics for the potion of healing you're going to need a few key items blaze powder a water bottle and a glistering melon slice first things first head over to your brewing stand to kick things off add one blaze powder into the leftmost slot to fire up the stand next place your water bottle in one of the bottom slots now the Brewing Magic Begins add a Nether wart into the top box of the brewing stand menu after it Brews swap that out for the glistering melon slice wait for the Brew to complete and voila you've got yourself a potion of healing don't forget to move this potion into your inventory but what if you want to amp up the effects let's talk about upgrading to a potion of healing too which gives you instant Health to for that extra boost you'll start with your potion of healing as the base add blaze powder again to activate the stand put your potion of healing in the bottom slot and top it off with some glowstone dust Brew it up and there you have it a more potent potion of healing to ready for any adventure for those of you using Java Edition the give command to get the potion of healing is if you're on Pocket Edition education Edition Windows 10 or console just use give AP potion 121 for the first potion and give AP potion 122 for the upgraded version and that's it Gamers you now know how to make and upgrade your potions of healing be sure to hit that like button and subscribe to the global gaming for more awesome Minecraft content until next time keep gaming and stay awesome

Tłumaczenie: Agnieszka Cabanes Korekta: Marta Konieczna Pokarm dla mózgu. Gdyby usunąć z mózgu całą wodę, a resztę rozbić na tworzące go składniki odżywcze, co otrzymalibyśmy? Większą część stanowiłyby tłuszcze, zwane również lipidami. W pozostałej substancji mózgowej znaleźlibyśmy białka i aminokwasy, ślady mikroelementów i glukozę. Mózg to dużo więcej niż kombinacja substancji odżywczych, ale każda z nich ma wpływ na nasze funkcjonowanie, rozwój, nastrój i poziom energii. Poobiednie zmęczenie czy bezsenność w nocy mogą wynikać z wpływu jedzenia na nasz mózg. Największymi gwiazdami wśród tłuszczów w naszym mózgu są omega 3 i 6. Te nienasycone kwasy tłuszczowe, które chronią nas przed  neurodegeneracyjnymi chorobami mózgu, pochodzą wyłącznie z pożywienia. Pokarmy bogate w omegakwasy jak orzechy, ziarna i tłuste ryby są niezbędne do tworzenia i utrzymania w dobrym stanie błon komórkowych. Tłuszcze omega są dobre dla naszego mózgu, ale regularne spożywanie innych, takich jak tłuszcze trans i nasycone, może zaszkodzić jego zdrowiu. Białka i aminokwasy, materiał budulcowy, dzięki któremu rośniemy i rozwijamy się, wpływają na nasze  samopoczucie i zachowanie. Aminokwasy zawierają prekursory neuroprzekaźników, substancji chemicznych przenoszących sygnały miedzy neuronami, które wpływają na nastrój, sen, koncentrację i masę ciała. Dzięki nim czujemy senność po zjedzeniu dużej porcji makaronu i jesteśmy bardziej uważni po posiłku bogatym w białko. Złożone kombinacje  związków chemicznych w jedzeniu mogą pobudzać komórki mózgu do wydzielania wpływającej na nastrój noradrenaliny, dopaminy i serotoniny. A że nie łatwo dotrzeć do komórek mózgu, aminokwasy muszą walczyć o ten ograniczony dostęp. Zróżnicowana dieta pomaga utrzymać zrównoważoną kombinację neuroprzekaźników i zapobiega nadmiernym wahaniom nastroju. Podobnie jak inne organy w naszym ciele, nasz mózg potrzebuje regularnej dawki mikroelementów. Antyoksydanty w owocach i warzywach wzmacniają go i zwalczają wolne rodniki niszczące komórki mózgowe, pozwalając mózgowi wydajnie pracować przez dłuższy okres czasu. Bez mocy mikroelementów, takich jak witamina B6, B12 czy kwas foliowy, nasze mózgi chorowałyby i traciły sprawność. Pierwiastki śladowe: żelazo, miedź, cynk, i sód są niezbędne dla zdrowia mózgu i wczesnego rozwoju poznawczego. Aby mózg mógł sprawnie  przetwarzać i syntetyzować te cenne składniki odżywcze, potrzebuje paliwa, i to w dużych ilościach. Chociaż mózg stanowi tylko około 2% masy naszego ciała, zużywa aż do 20% naszej energii. Większość pochodzi z węglowodanów, rozbijanych przy trawieniu na glukozę. Płaty czołowe tak silnie  reagują na jej spadek, że obniżenie sprawności umysłowej jest jednym z pierwszych sygnałów niedoboru tego składnika. Przyjmując, że dostarczamy glukozę regularnie, jak różne rodzaje węglowodanów wpływają na nasz mózg? Są trzy rodzaje węglowodanów: skrobia, cukier i błonnik. Choć na etykietach spożywczych są traktowane jako jedna kategoria, stosunek cukru i błonnika  do całkowitej ilości węglowodanów wpływa na reakcję organizmu i mózgu. Pokarmy wysokoglikemiczne, takie jak białe pieczywo, powodują szybki wzrost poziomu glukozy we krwi, a następnie jego szybki spadek. Obniża się nie tylko poziom glukozy ale i koncentracja i nastrój. Z kolei owies, ziarna i rośliny strączkowe wolniej podnoszą poziom glukozy, co pozwala utrzymać poziom koncentracji. Aby mózg działał płynnie, niezbędna jest zróżnicowana dieta, bogata w składniki odżywcze. To, co gryziemy, przeżuwamy i połykamy, ma bezpośredni i długotrwały wpływ na najważniejszy organ w naszym organizmie.

Hi everyone! Thank you for joining me and my dog Ted on this adventure!   We got such a wholesome, moody weather today. A lot of rain and fog.   I love watching the fog moving around the mountains so fast!   Trying a new tarp today, it’s made out of canvas.   Letting Ted out, let’s see if he wants to stay out or wait in the car for shelter to be ready   Ok Ted had enough exploring, he wants to wait in the car.   This video is sponsored by NATUREHIKE   How cool is that, it opens up into two burners.   I am impressed. The Quality of this stove feels and looks great. I love the color combination, it’s perfect for camping.   I am pretty excited to test my new cooking equipment today. It’s really nice!   The igniters seem to be very reliable. Not once did they fail throughout my whole camping day.   I am going to cook Pasta carbonara today. So two burners will come in handy!   Got couple of more new items to make it nice and organised! Love it!   It’s getting chilly, good that I brought some warm clothes. Did not expect that in summer in Australia. I guess up in the mountains is always cooler.   Of course Ted is out for the cooking part.   Got some Chicken Vegetables Stir Fried ready for Ted. He loves it.    It’s time to cook some pasta! Yum!   Ted on guard duty, making sure no cows are coming too close!   There is one curious cow watching us. “What you cooking?!”   Such incredible views from here!   What am I doing, I don’t need a knife to eat pasta xD   My pasta is ready! It’s time to eat and enjoy the views!   Ah, enjoying my moment to the fullest right now.   Ok we are both full, now let’s setup a shelter to sleep in tonight!   Got an interesting tent from Naturehike with me today. It’s kind of modular! hey everyone Anthony here from the global gaming and welcome back to our Minecraft Guide Series today we're diving into how to whip up a potion of healing also known as instant Health right in your own Minecraft world whether you're battling mobs or just after some quick Health boosts this potion is a must-have in your inventory let's start with the basics for the potion of healing you're going to need a few key items blaze powder a water bottle and a glistering melon slice first things first head over to your brewing stand to kick things off add one blaze powder into the leftmost slot to fire up the stand next place your water bottle in one of the bottom slots now the Brewing Magic Begins add a Nether wart into the top box of the brewing stand menu after it Brews swap that out for the glistering melon slice wait for the Brew to complete and voila you've got yourself a potion of healing don't forget to move this potion into your inventory but what if you want to amp up the effects let's talk about upgrading to a potion of healing too which gives you instant Health to for that extra boost you'll start with your potion of healing as the base add blaze powder again to activate the stand put your potion of healing in the bottom slot and top it off with some glowstone dust Brew it up and there you have it a more potent potion of healing to ready for any adventure for those of you using Java Edition the give command to get the potion of healing is if you're on Pocket Edition education Edition Windows 10 or console just use give AP potion 121 for the first potion and give AP potion 122 for the upgraded version and that's it Gamers you now know how to make and upgrade your potions of healing be sure to hit that like button and subscribe to the global gaming for more awesome Minecraft content until next time keep gaming and stay awesome

Your Brain on Food If you sucked all of the moisture out of your brain and broke it down to its constituent nutritional content, what would it look like? Most of the weight of your dehydrated  brain would come from fats, also known as lipids. In the remaining brain matter, you would find proteins and amino acids, traces of micronutrients, and glucose. The brain is, of course, more than just the sum of its nutritional parts, but each component does have a distinct impact on functioning, development, mood, and energy. So that post-lunch apathy, or late-night alertness you might be feeling, well, that could simply be the effects of food on your brain. Of the fats in your brain, the superstars are omegas 3 and 6. These essential fatty acids, which have been linked to preventing degenerative brain conditions, must come from our diets. So eating omega-rich foods, like nuts, seeds, and fatty fish, is crucial to the creation and maintenance of cell membranes. And while omegas are good fats for your brain, long-term consumption of other fats, like trans and saturated fats, may compromise brain health. Meanwhile, proteins and amino acids, the building block nutrients of growth and development, manipulate how we feel and behave. Amino acids contain the precursors to neurotransmitters, the chemical messengers that carry signals between neurons, affecting things like mood, sleep, attentiveness, and weight. They're one of the reasons we might feel calm after eating a large plate of pasta, or more alert after a protein-rich meal. The complex combinations  of compounds in food can stimulate brain cells to release mood-altering norepinephrine, dopamine, and serotonin. But getting to your brain cells is tricky, and amino acids have to compete for limited access. A diet with a range of foods helps  maintain a balanced combination of brain messengers, and keeps your mood from getting skewed in one direction or the other. Like the other organs in our bodies, our brains also benefit from a steady supply of micronutrients. Antioxidants in fruits and vegetables strengthen the brain to fight off free radicals that destroy brain cells, enabling your brain to work well for a longer period of time. And without powerful micronutrients, like the vitamins B6, B12, and folic acid, our brains would be susceptible  to brain disease and mental decline. Trace amounts of the minerals iron, copper, zinc, and sodium are also fundamental to brain health and early cognitive development. In order for the brain to efficiently transform and synthesize these valuable nutrients, it needs fuel, and lots of it. While the human brain only makes up about 2% of our body weight, it uses up to 20% of our energy resources. Most of this energy comes  from carbohydrates that our body digests into glucose, or blood sugar. The frontal lobes are so sensitive to drops in glucose, in fact, that a change in mental function is one of the primary signals of nutrient deficiency. Assuming that we are getting glucose regularly, how does the specific type  of carbohydrates we eat affect our brains? Carbs come in three forms: starch, sugar, and fiber. While on most nutrition labels, they are all lumped  into one total carb count, the ratio of the sugar and fiber subgroups to the whole amount affect how the body and brain respond. A high glycemic food, like white bread, causes a rapid release of glucose into the blood, and then comes the dip. Blood sugar shoots down, and with it, our attention span and mood. On the other hand, oats, grains, and legumes have slower glucose release, enabling a steadier level  of attentiveness. For sustained brain power, opting for a varied diet of nutrient-rich foods is critical. When it comes to what you bite, chew, and swallow, your choices have a direct and long-lasting effect on the most powerful organ in your body.

But getting to your brain cells is tricky, and amino acids have to compete for limited access. A diet with a range of foods helps  maintain a balanced combination of brain messengers, and keeps your mood from getting skewed in one direction or the other. Like the other organs in our bodies, our brains also benefit from a steady supply of micronutrients. Antioxidants in fruits and vegetables strengthen the brain to fight off free radicals that destroy brain cells, enabling your brain to work well for a longer period of time. And without powerful micronutrients, like the vitamins B6, B12, and folic acid, our brains would be susceptible  to brain disease and mental decline. Trace amounts of the minerals iron, copper, zinc, and sodium are also fundamental to brain health and early cognitive development. In order for the brain to efficiently transform and synthesize these valuable nutrients, it needs fuel, and lots of it. While the human brain only makes up about 2% of our body weight, it uses up to 20% of our energy resources. Most of this energy comes  from carbohydrates that our body digests into glucose, or blood sugar. The frontal lobes are so sensitive to drops in glucose, in fact, that a change in mental function is one of the primary signals of nutrient deficiency. Assuming that we are getting glucose regularly, how does the specific type  of carbohydrates we eat affect our brains? Carbs come in three forms: starch, sugar, and fiber. While on most nutrition labels, they are all lumped  into one total carb count, the ratio of the sugar and fiber subgroups to the whole amount affect how the body and brain respond. A high glycemic food, like white bread, causes a rapid release of glucose into the blood, and then comes the dip. Blood sugar shoots down, and with it, our attention span and mood. On the other hand, oats, grains, and legumes have slower glucose release, enabling a steadier level  of attentiveness. For sustained brain power, opting for a varied diet of nutrient-rich foods is critical. When it comes to what you bite, chew, and swallow, your choices have a direct and long-lasting effect on the most powerful organ in your body.

Your Brain on Food If you sucked all of the moisture out of your brain and broke it down to its constituent nutritional content, what would it look like? Most of the weight of your dehydrated  brain would come from fats, also known as lipids. In the remaining brain matter, you would find proteins and amino acids, traces of micronutrients, and glucose. The brain is, of course, more than just the sum of its nutritional parts, but each component does have a distinct impact on functioning, development, mood, and energy. So that post-lunch apathy, or late-night alertness you might be feeling, well, that could simply be the effects of food on your brain. Of the fats in your brain, the superstars are omegas 3 and 6. These essential fatty acids, which have been linked to preventing degenerative brain conditions, must come from our diets. So eating omega-rich foods, like nuts, seeds, and fatty fish, is crucial to the creation and maintenance of cell membranes. And while omegas are good fats for your brain, long-term consumption of other fats, like trans and saturated fats, may compromise brain health. Meanwhile, proteins and amino acids, the building block nutrients of growth and development, manipulate how we feel and behave. Amino acids contain the precursors to neurotransmitters, the chemical messengers that carry signals between neurons, affecting things like mood, sleep, attentiveness, and weight. They're one of the reasons we might feel calm after eating a large plate of pasta, or more alert after a protein-rich meal. The complex combinations  of compounds in food can stimulate brain cells to release mood-altering norepinephrine, dopamine, and serotonin. But getting to your brain cells is tricky, and amino acids have to compete for limited access. A diet with a range of foods helps  maintain a balanced combination of brain messengers, and keeps your mood from getting skewed in one direction or the other. Like the other organs in our bodies, our brains also benefit from a steady supply of micronutrients. Antioxidants in fruits and vegetables strengthen the brain to fight off free radicals that destroy brain cells, enabling your brain to work well for a longer period of time. And without powerful micronutrients, like the vitamins B6, B12, and folic acid, our brains would be susceptible  to brain disease and mental decline. Trace amounts of the minerals iron, copper, zinc, and sodium are also fundamental to brain health and early cognitive development. In order for the brain to efficiently transform and synthesize these valuable nutrients, it needs fuel, and lots of it. While the human brain only makes up about 2% of our body weight, it uses up to 20% of our energy resources. Most of this energy comes  from carbohydrates that our body digests into glucose, or blood sugar. The frontal lobes are so sensitive to drops in glucose, in fact, that a change in mental function is one of the primary signals of nutrient deficiency. Assuming that we are getting glucose regularly, how does the specific type  of carbohydrates we eat affect our brains? Carbs come in three forms: starch, sugar, and fiber. While on most nutrition labels, they are all lumped  into one total carb count, the ratio of the sugar and fiber subgroups to the whole amount affect how the body and brain respond. A high glycemic food, like white bread, causes a rapid release of glucose into the blood, and then comes the dip. Blood sugar shoots down, and with it, our attention span and mood. On the other hand, oats, grains, and legumes have slower glucose release, enabling a steadier level  of attentiveness. For sustained brain power, opting for a varied diet of nutrient-rich foods is critical. When it comes to what you bite, chew, and swallow, your choices have a direct and long-lasting effect on the most powerful organ in your body.

Your Brain on Food If you sucked all of the moisture out of your brain and broke it down to its constituent nutritional content, what would it look like? Most of the weight of your dehydrated  brain would come from fats, also known as lipids. In the remaining brain matter, you would find proteins and amino acids, traces of micronutrients, and glucose. The brain is, of course, more than just the sum of its nutritional parts, but each component does have a distinct impact on functioning, development, mood, and energy. So that post-lunch apathy, or late-night alertness you might be feeling, well, that could simply be the effects of food on your brain. Of the fats in your brain, the superstars are omegas 3 and 6. These essential fatty acids, which have been linked to preventing degenerative brain conditions, must come from our diets. So eating omega-rich foods, like nuts, seeds, and fatty fish, is crucial to the creation and maintenance of cell membranes. And while omegas are good fats for your brain, long-term consumption of other fats, like trans and saturated fats, may compromise brain health. Meanwhile, proteins and amino acids, the building block nutrients of growth and development, manipulate how we feel and behave. Amino acids contain the precursors to neurotransmitters, the chemical messengers that carry signals between neurons, affecting things like mood, sleep, attentiveness, and weight. They're one of the reasons we might feel calm after eating a large plate of pasta, or more alert after a protein-rich meal. The complex combinations  of compounds in food can stimulate brain cells to release mood-altering norepinephrine, dopamine, and serotonin. But getting to your brain cells is tricky, and amino acids have to compete for limited access. A diet with a range of foods helps  maintain a balanced combination of brain messengers, and keeps your mood from getting skewed in one direction or the other. Like the other organs in our bodies, our brains also benefit from a steady supply of micronutrients. Antioxidants in fruits and vegetables strengthen the brain to fight off free radicals that destroy brain cells, enabling your brain to work well for a longer period of time. And without powerful micronutrients, like the vitamins B6, B12, and folic acid, our brains would be susceptible  to brain disease and mental decline. Trace amounts of the minerals iron, copper, zinc, and sodium are also fundamental to brain health and early cognitive development. In order for the brain to efficiently transform and synthesize these valuable nutrients, it needs fuel, and lots of it. While the human brain only makes up about 2% of our body weight, it uses up to 20% of our energy resources. Most of this energy comes  from carbohydrates that our body digests into glucose, or blood sugar. The frontal lobes are so sensitive to drops in glucose, in fact, that a change in mental function is one of the primary signals of nutrient deficiency. Assuming that we are getting glucose regularly, how does the specific type  of carbohydrates we eat affect our brains? Carbs come in three forms: starch, sugar, and fiber. While on most nutrition labels, they are all lumped  into one total carb count, the ratio of the sugar and fiber subgroups to the whole amount affect how the body and brain respond. A high glycemic food, like white bread, causes a rapid release of glucose into the blood, and then comes the dip. Blood sugar shoots down, and with it, our attention span and mood. On the other hand, oats, grains, and legumes have slower glucose release, enabling a steadier level  of attentiveness. For sustained brain power, opting for a varied diet of nutrient-rich foods is critical. When it comes to what you bite, chew, and swallow, your choices have a direct and long-lasting effect on the most powerful organ in your body.

Hoje vou te revelar cinco erros noturnos que estão te deixando doente silenciosamente. Sou o Dr. Ver, médico cardiologista, e você vai aprender não só como evitar esses erros, mas também uma solução para cada um deles. Vou te dizer exatamente o que falo para meus pacientes no consultório. E por favor, prestem muita atenção, porque o erro número dois e o número um são os mais letais de todos. E tenho certeza de que o erro número um tá agora mesmo na sua mesa de cabeceira. E não, não, não é o que você tá pensando. Atenção, se você acorda para urinar toda hora durante a noite, esse é o nosso erro número cinco. É desesperador, não te deixa dormir, você acorda o tempo todo. É o que meus pacientes me dizem. Mas o que eles não sabem é que isso pode acontecer por duas ou três coisas que vou te revelar agora mesmo. Número um, você tem varizes nas pernas ou elas simplesmente ficam inchadas à tarde? Bom, você precisa saber que ali se acumula muita água e acontece o seguinte, muitas pessoas trabalham o dia todo, chegam à noite com as pernas inchadas, jantam e depois vão dormir. Quando se deitam, a água das pernas é reabsorvida e volta pro sangue, pro coração e pros rins. E claro, depois de deitar por 2, 3, 4 horas, você começa a urinar toda hora a corda. Qual é a solução? Levante as pernas duas a tr horas antes de deitar. Você pode fazer isso sentado em uma cadeira, com as pernas apoiadas em outra, ou em um sofá um pouco mais baixo com as pernas sobre uma mesinha. Faça isso durante 40, 50 minutos ou até 1 hora. Isso fará com que o líquido nas suas pernas comece a ser reabsorvido. E se você fizer isso duas a 3 horas antes de deitar, vai urinar antes de dormir e vai se levantar muito menos durante a noite. Mas cuidado, porque acumular líquido nas pernas pode indicar um problema cardíaco ou nos rins. Nesses casos, sempre é fundamental consultar um cardiologista, um clínico ou um nefrologista. O segundo motivo pelo qual você se levanta para urinar toda hora à noite é usar água de forma errada. O que eu tô dizendo? Eu tô dizendo algo muito simples. Você deve beber água o dia todo, desde que acorda até duas ou 3 horas antes de deitar. Repito, até duas ou 3 horas antes de deitar, quando você deve diminuir a quantidade de água que toma. Você só deve beber pequenos goles nas últimas duas ou três horas antes de dormir. O que muitas pessoas fazem? Deixam um copinho de água e antes de dormir bebem tudo. E claro, três, 4, 5 horas depois você vai acordar duas ou três vezes para urinar. Acordar toda hora aumenta a pressão, altera seu metabolismo, seu cérebro, seu coração e aumenta o risco de infartos e AVCs. E isso não é tudo, porque também aumenta o risco de você escorregar e cair. O que é sujeiro? Duas a três horas antes de deitar, beba apenas pequenos goles. Não beba grandes quantidades. Você deveria ter bebido água desde que acordou até esse momento. Não tô dizendo para não tomar água, tô dizendo para diminuir antes de deitar. Muita atenção agora para quem janta tarde e pesado. Esse é o nosso erro número quatro. O que acontece? Jantar e ir direto pra cama obriga seu corpo a trabalhar por horas. Não te parece lógico comer e deitar? Seus alimentos onde vão estar? no seu estômago, que vai estar trabalhando cheia, isso vai aumentar o refluxo ácida. Além disso, seus intestinos vão estar recebendo alimentos e seu metabolismo, que como você já sabe, é lento à noite, vai ser obrigado a absorver açúcar e gorduras. Ou seja, seu cortisol vai estar nas alturas e isso vai fazer com que você durma mal. Mesmo que você consiga dormir, vai dormir mal, porque seu cortisol estará alto, você estará em um momento de estresse. Isso não só faz com que você durma mal, aumenta sua pressão, seu refluxo, mas como cardiologista eu te digo, hoje sabemos que jantar tarde e pesado está associado ao aumento do risco de infartos e de derrames cerebrais, entre outros problemas. Qual é a solução? Jante pelo menos 2 horas ou três, se puder, antes de dormir. Myślisz, że widziałeś już wszystko w medycynie? Zastanów się jeszcze raz. Medquesttino zaskoczy cię. Tutaj w Medquestino nie jesteśmy typowym kanałem medycznym. Zapomnij o podręcznikowych wykładach i nudnych faktach. To miejsce na intrygujące historie, zadziwiające ciekawostki i moje szczere refleksje ze świata medycyny. Zagłębimy się w tajemnice, o których lekarze rzadko mówią. Odkryjemy dziwaczną stronę nauki i zakwestionujemy to, co myślałeś, że wiesz o zdrowiu. Podzielę się z wami spostrzeżeniami z prawdziwego świata, dziwnymi przypadkami, świeżymi perspektywami, których nie znajdziecie nigdzie indziej. Wszystko w zabawny, przystępny i łatwy do zrozumienia sposób. Niezależnie od tego, czy jesteś ciekawym umysłem, przyszłym medykiem, czy po prostu kimś, kto kocha dobrą historię, jesteś we właściwym miejscu. Więc kliknij subskrybuj, zapnij pasy i przygotuj się, by zobaczyć medycynę w zupełnie nowym świetle. tylko na medestino.
